content:
We should be showing the full file name (pasted image) here right?
pasted image
Also it's inconsistent for some reason, I see more of the file name(past...) compared to Steve's (pa...)
@Sampriti Panda yeah, that looks like a bug. Might be a regression in e071d27b6ba3bffad0692baee21089172d1680aa; @Cynthia Lin any ideas?
Oh looks like I forgot to commit 1 CSS rule? I'll open a PR tmrw when I find more time

@Tim Abbott
Hi. I'm Taiki.
I think the arrows for image list are positioned a little too bottom.
Is this part of design or bug? If this is a bug, I'll fix this problem.
image-list-arrow-position.png

Here is, I made new design plan for image preview.
■Currently, images are abruptly hidden by a header and a footer.
I think this is not user friendly, so in the idea, they are colored by transparent color.
currently.png

new.png

■And some pretty icons made with css.
icon.png

■And easy-to-understand selection display
selection.png

What do you all think about this plan !?

Hello again Taiki! FYI, you don't need to mention people so often. That's more for when you need someone's attention sooner, or you think they might not see your message otherwise. I mentioned you elsewhere a couple of times since you're a new user and I wanted to make sure you saw my response – though you might have noticed I only did it twice before dropping the mentions – but you definitely don't need to mention Tim Abbott here. :smile:
Also note the difference between @Cyphase and Cyphase. You get the latter by starting the mention with @_ instead.

As written here: https://zulip.com/development-community/#getting-help

Use @-mentions sparingly. Unlike IRC or Slack, Zulip‘s topics make it easy to see what you’re replying to, so you don’t need to mention your conversation partner to make sure they will see or understand your reply. Core contributors will often @-mention someone who asked a question hours earlier to make sure they see the reply, but there is generally no need to @-mention a core contributor unless you need their timely attention.

Hi! Cyphase. As you said, I was able to find this message !:rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
I now understand the meaning of that note and the customs here. Thanks!

Thanks for digging into this part of the product Taiki !

  1. I think the arrows for image list are positioned a little too bottom.

Yes, that looks like a bug to me. I'd be happy for us to merge a PR to vertically center those arrows.

  1. I think this is not user friendly, so in the idea, they are colored by transparent color.

@Vlad Korobov what do you think about this proposal?

  1. And some pretty icons made with css.

I didn't follow here -- can you explain the proposed change in more detail?

  1. And easy-to-understand selection display

I think adding a border and rounding corners looks nice, but the proposed border might be too much. @Vlad Korobov any feedback here?

Thank you for your support!
I explain about 3.
Currently(below images), the close button and the arrow button are made with letter, ”X” and “>”.
I felt they are not beautiful as a part of our design so I made icons with CSS.
(deleted)
(deleted)
CB1F5C3F-910A-4144-B72B-E805698DA9F9.jpg
B99D229D-A215-467D-8765-33635F1993A9.jpg
Ah, I see, thanks for clarifying! I'll let Vlad Korobov comment on the icons as well.

Lets use the proper icons. Hit target should be as in a regular button, but the icon is 16px
close.svg
chevron-left.svg
chevron-right.svg
@Taiki

Thank you for your feedback Vlad Korobov !
I replaced icons to SVG images.
About size, you mean that I need to set image size 16px x 16px, right?
I felt little bit too small… if this is direction of design, it’s no problem but.
16pxsvg.jpg
I agree they are small but don’t have a better solution right now
Is it better for the buttons to be vertically centered with respect to the x (current) or top-aligned (proposed)?
Oh, it's true. I forget to make the icon to be centered.

I made a PR about this.
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/23458
你好
